medical_history.chief_complaint: History of multiple vertebral compression fractures.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At age 10, the patient fractured T6 while riding a roller coaster. At age 10 3/4, she fractured T3 playing sports, and at age 11 1/2, she fractured T5 playing laser tag. Two additional thoracic vertebral fractures followed. The patient experienced back pain that was treated with pain medications and muscle relaxants.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously very athletic, with normal puberty and otherwise healthy. A bone marrow biopsy of T6 performed by a hematologist was normal.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father has a history of several sports-related fractures as a child. The mother and siblings are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient consumes at least three servings of dairy per day and is restricted from playing contact sports due to her condition.
